definition: Sui dynasty (581-617)
the Sui dynasty (581-617 AD)/surname Sui
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning

sentences.english: Short-lived Sui Dynasty, Tang Dynasty, will soon be replaced.
sentences.chinese: 隋朝短暂，很快被唐朝取代。

sentences.english: Imperial selection started at the beginning of Sui Dynasty, so the tendency of examinations began to spread.
sentences.chinese: 在隋朝开始的科举选才，应试之风开始蔓延。

sentences.english: A series of cultural conformity and reconstruction activities were carried out after Sui Dynasty united the whole nation.
sentences.chinese: 隋朝统一全国后，展开了一系列文化整合重建活动。

sentences.english: Yang Jian established the Suih Dynasty, and China was united again.
sentences.chinese: 杨坚重新统一了中国，建立了隋朝。

sentences.english: And Li Mi hung his book on a horn of his cow and made time to read it.
sentences.chinese: 隋朝的李密把书挂在牛角上，一有时间就读。

sentences.english: gigli. Festival originated from the sui dynasty.
During the Sui Dynasty, yellow was officially designated as the exclusive color for the imperial family.
sentences.chinese: 从隋朝起，黄色成为皇家专用的颜色。

sentences.english: Tianjin region began as the formation of the sui dynasty waterway.
sentences.chinese: 天津地区的形成始于隋朝大运河的开通。

sentences.english: One of the first recorded accounts of using hygienic paper was during the Sui Dynasty in 589.
sentences.chinese: 最早使用卫生纸的记录出现在隋朝589年。

sentences.english: Sui Dynasty began to open branches to take disabilities, also taking the first scholar.
sentences.chinese: 隋朝开始开科取士，最初亦为取秀才。

sentences.english: But before long their country was in danger of being invaded by the troops of the Sui Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 但当时，隋朝正入侵陈国，陈国即将被灭亡。

sentences.english: Li Mi who lived in the Sui Dynasty put his whole heart into study, not wanting to waste any time .
sentences.chinese: 隋朝时的李密专心学习，不愿意浪费一点儿时间。

sentences.english: About ten years later, the resources of the country was used up so Sui Dynasty died out.
sentences.chinese: 十几年后，国力耗尽，隋朝也随之灭亡了。

definition: Emperor Yang of Sui (569-618), said to have murdered his father and brother to seize the throne, reigned 604-618
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Tang dynasty (618-907)
the Northern Zhou Dynasty (557-581)/one of the Northern Dynasties
last years of the Sui dynasty/early 7th century AD
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Emperor Gaozu of Tang, reign name of first Tang emperor Li Yuan 李淵|李渊[Li3 Yuan1] (566-635), reigned 618-626
Sui (581-617) and Tang dynasties (618-907)
Jin Dynasty (265-420)
Wei of the Northern Dynasties (386-534), founded by the Tuoba 拓跋 branch of Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑
Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
Western Jin dynasty (265-316)
Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Northern and Southern dynasties (420-589)
Emperor Gaozong of Tang, reign name of third Tang emperor Li Zhi 李治[Li3 Zhi4] (628-683), reigned 649-683
Han Dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
